CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection allowed (Article 35-1 - Six month period)

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . He suffered a personal injury while doing his military service . He was hospitalised on DATE and subsequently underwent several operations on his right knee . He is now permanently disabled .

CARDINAL . CARDINAL . CARDINAL expert reports ordered by ORG were added to the case file . The first , dated DATE , established a PERCENT disability . It awarded him a further TRY CARDINAL in respect of non - pecuniary damage . On DATE , following tacit dismissal of the claim by the administrative authorities , the applicant lodged a fresh claim with ORG for additional compensation , namely , TRY CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL ) , on the basis of the expert report of DATE . He argued that he had received the expert report of DATE on CARDINAL May CARDINAL , whereupon he had become aware of the true extent of the damage he had suffered .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG considered the applicant ’s fresh claim to be an application to have the initial amount amended ( ıslah ) and dismissed it for being out of time . The court stated in particular :

“ The claimant has clearly sought an amendment of the initial amount . The purpose of an amendment is to rectify a procedural act . Having regard to the judgment of ORG published in ORG of DATE , we must conclude that , in civil law , injured persons are entitled to seek additional compensation once an expert report has been issued . However , in the proceedings before ORG , the time - limits of DATE and DATE from the date of referral to the administrative authorities apply . Under section CARDINAL ) of ORG , the amount claimed can not be rectified once those deadlines have passed . Consequently , this claim must be rejected for being out of time ... ”
CARDINAL judge ( out of CARDINAL ) expressed a dissenting opinion . He stated in particular :

“ The amount of damage in personal injury cases is established only upon production of an expert report . Moreover , the date on which such reports are confirmed is taken into account when calculating the time - limits for referral to the administrative authorities and for bringing an action ...

The claim for additional compensation based on the expert report was lodged within the relevant time - limit because the applicant did not become aware of the extent of the damage until after that report had been issued .... ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application for rectification of the judgment .
CARDINAL . By a judgment of DATE , served on the applicant on DATE , ORG rejected that application .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) and Article CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure provide that if the dies ad quem of a time - limit is a public holiday , that time - limit will be extended to the following DATE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , entitled “ General Rule of Interpretation ” , states that a treaty shall be interpreted “ in good faith in accordance with the ordinary meaning to be given to the terms of the treaty in their context and in the light of its object and purpose . ”

CARDINAL . LAW on the Calculation of Time - Limits , opened for signature on DATE in GPE , came into force on CARDINAL DATE . It was drawn up with a view to establishing uniform NORP rules for calculating time - limits on the basis of responses obtained from governments . It applies both domestically and internationally , as clearly stated in the preamble thereto which affirms that “ the unification of rules relating to the calculation of time - limits , both for domestic and international purposes ” , will contribute to the attainment of greater unity between ORG member GPE ( see the explanatory report ) . Currently , CARDINAL of the CARDINAL signatory States have ratified that Convention . GPE has neither signed it nor acceded to it .

“ DATE , DATE and official holidays shall count when calculating a timelimit . However , where the dies ad quem of a timelimit before the expiry of which an act shall be performed is a DATE , a DATE , an official holiday or DATE which shall be considered as an official holiday , the timelimit shall be extended to include the first working day thereafter . ”
